summary: ZIKV is a single stranded RNA flavivirus that was first identified in the zika forest of Uganda in 1947 from Rhesus monkeys. some cases of human infection were reported in africa and Asia [2,3] before the first major outbreak on the island of Yap in the Federated States of Micronesia in 2007 [4]. most of those who do have them have symptoms that are almost indistinguishable from those of other causes of undifferentiated systemic febrile illness, RT-PCR (RT-PCR) has been the most commonly used laboratory diagnostic assay for ZIKV infection worldwide. a number of specific real-time and conventional RT-PCR assays targeting the envelope (E), premembrane (prM), nonstructural proteins 1 (NS1), NS2B, NS3 and NS5 gene coding regions of the ZIKV genome have been described [18–24] all procedures and handling of mice were conducted under approved protocol. expression of fusion protein Nonstructural 1 (NS1) and Envelope (E) proteins were used as diagnostic target of anti-ZIKV. western blot was analyzed on SDS-PAGE and western blot. eluate was dialyzed using Tris-Cl (pH 8.0) for 24 hr by changing the buffer thrice. supernatants of hybridoma cell culture were screened by ELISA using the recombinant NS1 or E proteins (1 g/ml) as an antigen. selected hybridoma colonies were transferred into 25 cm2 tissue culture flasks (Nunc, Roskilde, Denmark) with RPMI-1640 medium (Gibco/BRL). the final results were agreed upon by 3 investigators. the procedure does not require specific technic, can be tested easily and rapidly. ISA, plaque reduction neutralization test (PRNT) and PCR were performed on 30 Zika Positive Specimens provided by the hospital Gaffree e Guinle (Rio de Janeiro, Brazil) a sample was considered positive if the optical density (OD) at 490 nm was 2-fold greater than that of a blank (PBS) sample. RNA extracts from serum samples were prepared for PCR using an ExiPrep Viral RNA Kit (Bioneer Co., Daejeon, Korea) RNA was extracted from 20 l of serum and eluted in 50 l of elution buffer. ethics statement This study was performed under the regulation of the IRB Committee of FEMPTEC and the IRB Committee of BahiaFarma (2016-01-02). all participants provided written informed consent, and no minors were involved in the study. the recombinant proteins (100 g/250 l) were mixed with equal volumes of Freund’s complete adjuvants. after the third injection, the recombinant proteins (100 g/250 l) were injected intravenously without adjuvant. mouse myeloma cells (SP2/0 cell; ATCC #CRL 1581) were fused with spleen cells from the donor mice using 50% polyethylene glycol (Sigma Chemical Co.) supernatants of hybridoma cell culture were screened using the recombinant ZIKV NS1 or E proteins (1 g/ml) as an antigen. a 1-hr incubation was followed with anti-mouse IgG-horseradish peroxidase (HRP) conjugate at RT and 3,3′,5,5′-tetramethylbenzidine solution was added after final washing. the final results were agreed upon by 3 investigators. the procedure does not require any specific technic, can be tested easily and rapidly, and showed clear results. real-time RT-PCR is the only method officially approved and used as the gold standard diagnostic method. cells were overlaid with 2 ml of DMEM with 2% FBS and 1.5% SeaPlaque agarose (Lonza) plates were incubated at 37°C for 3–5 days. after this period, cells were washed twice with PBS, stained with 1% crystal violet for 30 min. cross reactions with DENV were evaluated using anti-Dengue Mixed Titer Performance Panel (PVD201) cross reactions with west Nile, yellow fever, and hepatitis C virus were also determined.
